item.description: JNDI - Java Naming and Directory Interface Object storing There are several ways an object satisfies the condition to be bound to a JDNI context. serializable objects: Serializable referenceable objects and references: Reference, ObjectFactory, Referenceable, RefAddr objects with attributes: DirContext remote objects: Remote Let's look at the real life example: how we bind DataSource and UserTransaction to a JNDI context MySQL package com.mysql.jdbc.jdbc2.optional; public class MysqlDataSource extends ConnectionPropertiesImpl implements DataSource, Referenceable, Serializable { //.
